result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kirsten M Harvey

records.addlTxt:
3:19 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kirsten M Harvey appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

WOPH:
Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

ARRAINMENT:
Attorney Richardson is heard, defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kristen M Harvey in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Kristen M Harvey.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards is heard. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

Atty Richards is ready to schedule the preliminary hearing. Atty Richards is heard and waives the time limits for the prelim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:59 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kirsten Mary Harvey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.

State is heard on bond.  State requests a $250.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant has no comment. 

Court orders a $250.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
